creator: issues.apache.org@chsc.dk
text:
Ant distinguishes between "Main targets" and "Other targets". The difference is whether they have a description attribute or not.

ant -projecthelp only returns the main targets, unless there are no main targets.

AFAICT this distinction is not used other places than in ant -projecthelp, so I would think that people are generally not aware of this distinction and hence sometimes forget to add descriptions to their targets. I have personally used Ant for a long time without noticing that some of my tasks lack a description.

complete-ant-cmd.pl currently only suggests main targets. I think it should suggest all targets.

creator: issues.apache.org@chsc.dk
text:
Created attachment 32436
Use -debug to fetch "Other tasks"

This patch also fixes bug 51931.
it might be a good idea to still leave out targets whose name starts with "-" since you cannot specify them on the command line
creator: bodewig@apache.org
issues.apache.org@chsc.dk
text:
Created attachment 32441
Use -debug to fetch "Other tasks", v2

Good idea. Fixed.
